topic.title: [Desktop Software] Tixati 2.43
topic.body:
[Tixati](https://www.tixati.com/) is a proprietary cross-platform BitTorrent client.

> Unlike many other torrent clients, we take pride in saying NO to spyware and adware.  Tixati installs and uninstalls cleanly and doesn't add anything extra to your system.  Our software is fully self-contained and doesn't have annoying dependencies on Java or .Net frameworks.

The portable bundle contains Windows and Linux binaries.

Source: https://download3.tixati.com/download/tixati-2.43-1.portable.tar.bz2
SHA256: 99ee6ee68a155fd26273dd088ef815672934d4680e3cf53aea4654ee9c159007
MD5: 8ff86a6b6e809c4b87cf41dbd9f8b7b7

8_1CSc14JKdGAQJfQsfCLrduhB6zU4oEMwBf.body: [aria2c](https://aria2.github.io/) downloads http, ftp, magnet, and metalink from the command line.  It automatically checks SHA, MD5, and Adler32 hashes.  Maybe its [web interface](https://github.com/ziahamza/webui-aria2) could be adapted into ZeroNet.
Is there a bitcoin client that would be easy to use with ZeroNet's site donations?

4_1CSc14JKdGAQJfQsfCLrduhB6zU4oEMwBf.body: Another possibility is cloning the site and removing its "privatekey" line from users.json.  Then you can still modify the site, and nobody controls the backup.  There is just the problem of getting enough seeds to keep each backup online while it is needed.

> [ergo](#comment_1_1AeoDwzudke45NR3b6LfU4LsmPFs8AXUvi): Having trouble using zeronet in Tor browser

Someone else had problems until they [added 127.0.0.1](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_1NhxEZGje74GQWUdX4frXE3TUg8evizrSS/Is+there+a+ZeroNet+browser) to their proxy exceptions.  The Tor browser also has stricter https and scripting rules, which might interfere with some ZeroNet sites.

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_18_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): Would there be an automated script which can log which ZeroNetID made a particular change (so we can trace a source of malicious edits)?

It would be easy to track changes made by specific users based on which files get modified during updates.  Determining who has changed the entire site with a shared private key would probably be much harder.

> [ergo](#comment_2_1AeoDwzudke45NR3b6LfU4LsmPFs8AXUvi): Thanks tkarita. Any suggestions on greater privacy?

Are you starting ZeroNet in "tor always" mode?

2_1FEikAyxCNPJcW996B69r5UFg29yfq579m.body: Progress bars would require support in ZeroNet.  File transfers seem to be all-or-nothing, without much error handling aside from a checksum pass or fail.

1_1GervYZoP82e8X1Rgc4wyMkJY2zSsJuq8t.body: Something went wrong; the download link for this was replaced with "http://127.0.0.1:43110/12oGb8xBjLYz23CGJxRQyzZ6mGybZokEKt/files/".
